edu.bu.battleship.game.ships

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.bu.battleship.game.ships.Ship

  • public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a Ship in the game of Battleship. A Ship is defined as a single coordinate (the left-most coordinate if HORIZONTALLY positioned or the top-most coordinate if VERTICALLY positioned), an orientation (HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL) and a ShipType. The ShipType specifies how many squares this Ship occupies. Aircraft Carriers occupy 5 squares, Battleships occupy 4, Destroyers and Submarines occupy 3 each, and Patrol Boats occupy 2. Ships also have unique ids (ints) like in Sepia to help differentiate different Ship objects from each other.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public final int getId()

      • getType

        public final Ship.ShipType getType()

      • getSrcCoordinate

        public final Coordinate getSrcCoordinate()
        A getter method to get the source coordinate of this Ship. The source coordinate is the coordinate that the rest of the ship's coordinates are derived from. If the ship is oriented HORIZONTALLY, then the source coordinate is the left-most coordinate that the ship occupies. If the ship is oriented VERTICALLY, then the source coordinate is the top-most coordinate that the ship occupies. This is done to standardize how ships are represented.
        Returns:
        The source coordinate of this Ship.

      • getOrientation

        public final Ship.Orientation getOrientation()

      • size

        public int size()
        A getter method to get the number of squares that this ship occupies. This value depends on the ShipType of this Ship. Aircraft Carriers occupy 5 squares, Battleships occupy 4, Destroyers and Submarines occupy 3 each, and Patrol Boats occupy 2.
        Returns:
        The number of squares that this Ship occupies.

      • getCoordinates

        public final java.util.Set<Coordinate> getCoordinates()

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        A getter method to get the number of undamaged squares that this ship occupies. Every time this ship is HIT (i.e. one of this Ship's Coordinates is guessed by the opponent), this value is decremented by 1. When this value equals zero, then all of the coordinates that this Ship occupies must have been guessed by the opponent and this ship is SUNK (and the opponent is notified).

      • hit

        public void hit()
        A method to damage this ship. Please do not call this, this is called by the game engine and I didn't want to have to create ShipView objects to prevent you from calling this.

      • makeCoordinates

        public final Coordinate[] makeCoordinates()
        A helper method to calculate all of the coordinates that this Ship occupies. Please don't call this, this is invoked in the constructor of the Ship and these values are cached for speed.
        Returns:
        A 1d array of Coordinates that this Ship occupies.

      • containsCoordinate

        public boolean containsCoordinate(Coordinate coords)
        A helper method to determine if a Coordinate is one of the coordinates that this Ship occupies.
        Parameters:
        coords: - The coordinate to check
        Returns:
        true if coords is one of the Coordinates this Ship occupies, and false otherwise.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A clone of this Ship but located at a new source coordinate.

      • create

        public static Ship create(int id,
                          Ship.ShipType type,
                          Coordinate c,
                          Ship.Orientation o)
        A static factory method to create a Ship object.
        Parameters:
        id: - The id of the new Ship object.
        type: - The ShipType of the new Ship object.
        c: - The source coordinate of the new Ship object.
        o: - The orientation of the new Ship object.
        Returns:
        A Ship object with the provided values.
